article_metadata.description: Comprehensively calculated health costs likely exceeded $4.9 trillion in 2015. This figure includes components of health spending not measured in official estimates estimates of health spending (e.g., complementary and alternative medicine and nutrition supplements), as well as informal care and the excess burden (deadweight losses) of taxes used to finance health care. How fast this burden rises in future years depends heavily on whether Obamacare limps along in the same fashion it has since 2010 or whether instead it is fundamentally transformed or replaced in the years ahead.
article_metadata.author: The Apothecary
